graph_title: Researchers (in full-time equivalent) per million inhabitants
indicator_name: Researchers (in full-time equivalent) per million inhabitants

sources.url_text: Statistics on Scientific Research and Technological Development Activities - R&D

indicador_disponible: Researchers (in full-time equivalent) per million inhabitants
objetivo_global: 9- Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
meta_global: 9.5 Enhance scientific research, upgrade the technological capabilities of industrial sectors in all countries, in particular developing countries, including, by 2030, encouraging innovation and substantially increasing the number of research and development workers per 1 million people and public and private research and development spending
definicion: Number of researchers in full-time equivalent jobs per million inhabitants
formula:
$$TINV^{t} = \frac{INV^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 1.000.000$$

where:

$INV^{t} =$ researchers in full-time equivalent jobs in year $t$

$P^{t} =$ population as of 1 July of year $t$
texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
justificacion_global:
The indicator is a direct measure of the number of research and experimental development (R&D) 
workers per 1 million people referred to in the target.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
dato_global: Researchers (in full-time equivalent) per million inhabitants (per 1,000,000 population) GB_POP_SCIERD UNSTATS
comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Researchers (in full-time equivalent) per million inhabitants
es.objetivo_global: 9- Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
es.meta_global: 9.5 Enhance scientific research, upgrade the technological capabilities of industrial sectors in all countries, in particular developing countries, including, by 2030, encouraging innovation and substantially increasing the number of research and development workers per 1 million people and public and private research and development spending
es.definicion: Número de personas investigadoras en equivalencia a jornada completa por cada millón de habitantes
es.formula:
$$TINV^{t} = \frac{INV^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 1.000.000$$

donde:

$INV^{t} =$ personas investigadoras en equivalencia a jornada completa en el año $t$

$P^{t} =$ población a 1 de julio del año $t$
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
El indicador es una medida directa del número de trabajadores de investigación y desarrollo experimental (I+D) por cada millón de personas a las que se refiere la meta.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.dato_global: Investigadores (en equivalente a tiempo completo) por millón de habitantes (por cada 1.000.000 de habitantes) GB_POP_SCIERD UNSTATS
es.comparabilidad: El indicador disponible cumple con los metadatos del indicador de Naciones Unidas.
